Detailed Description

File related to search starting ( page_2 ).

In this module, main() function is implemented. It handles parsing program arguments and according to them coordinates other modules

Function Documentation

Group_status analyze_single_position ( string  pos_name,
Stone_color  color_to_move,
double *  act_time,
string  save_filename 
)

Analyzes single position stored in file with filename as first argument, when second argument stone color moves first.

Parameters:
[in] pos_name is a string containing name of position to solve.
[in] color_to_move is states player starting in the position.
[in] act_time_pt is pointer to actual amount of time spend.
[in] string_filename is filename into which is output sgf saved ( in case of iddfs )
Returns:
Returns result of the search.

This function performs all neccessary operations for tree search in one position ( e.g. attacker moves first , defender moves first ). Neccessary initializations are done before searching is started.

string get_out_fn_base ( string  filename  ) 

Generates output filename from input string.

Parameters:
[in] filename Input problem filename to be transformed
Returns:
Returns transformed filename *
void handle_single_problem ( string  filename,
bool  sgf_output,
int *  total_nodes_pt,
double *  total_time_pt 
)

Completely solves given problem.

Parameters:
[in] filename Is the name of file where the problem is saved.
[in] sgf_output Tells whether to print sgf output or not ( for instance in multiple positions mode sgf output is not printed )
[in] total_nodes_pt Pointer to actual number of totally searched nodes.
[in] total_time_pt Pointer to actual amount of total time spend.

This function takes care of one single problem ( that means two positions : attacker moves first , defender moves first ). It also manages neccessary output.

int main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

Function main at first parses input arguments and according to them decides further actions.
